document_data.name: Wall of Fire

document_data.mainbody: '''''Wall of fire''''' was an [[evocation]] or [[conjuration]] spell that raised a one-sided opaque curtain of flames in the form of a segmented wall or a circle. Between the [[Spellplague]] and the [[Second Sundering]], the wall was two-sided, but was again one-sided afterwards.
document_data.Effects:
The wall was oriented vertically with respect to the caster and did not move once created.<ref group="note">In the earliest version of this spell, the circle form of the ''wall of fire'' moved with the druid who cast it. The shape and the flaming side of the wall was determined by the caster and the maximum size of the wall was determined by the caster's level. The sheet of flame lasted for up to 1 minute, as long as the caster maintained concentration, or for a minimum time if the caster became distracted. or greenish-yellow to [[amber]] if created by divine magic. The wall was only {{SI|1|ft|c|long=yes}} thick.

Any creature near the flaming side of the wall was subject to harm from the heat, although the farther away, the less intense the heat. Any creature passing through the wall suffered greatly—[[undead]] and other creatures susceptible to fire got the worst of it. 

Betweeen the Spellplague and the Second Sundering, a ''wall of fire'' was limited to {{SI|40|ft|long=yes}} in length, made up of {{SIAdj|5|ft}} orthogonal segments, and only lasted a few seconds. The range of this spell was {{SI|50|ft|long=yes}}. A creature passing through this version of ''wall of fire'' was also slowed by a few steps.
document_data.Components: [[Verbal component|Verbal]], [[Somatic component|somatic]], and [[material component]]s were required to cast this spell, including a small bit of [[phosphorus]] for arcane casters.
document_data.History:
This spell was introduced by the [[arcanist]] and Fire Warden of [[Netheril]] [[Noanar]] in {{Yearlink|-2311}} under the name '''''Noanar's wall'''''.

In the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, the [[drow]] [[wizard]] [[Kilili]] cast a ''wall of fire'' to hold off some warriors threatening the mage [[Parwyyd Hanifar]].{{Cite comic/Day of the Darkening|14}}
